−
'''Morality''' (from the [[Latin]] ''{{Lang|la|moralitas}}'' "manner, character, proper behavior") is a [[understanding|sense]] of [[behavior]]al conduct that differentiates intentions, decisions, and [[Social actions|actions]] between those that are good (or right) and bad (or wrong). The system they came up with is not followed with today. A ''moral code'' is a system of morality (for example, according to a particular [[philosophy]], [[religion]], [[culture]], etc.) and a ''moral'' is any one practice or teaching within a moral code. ''Immorality'' is the active opposition to morality, while ''amorality'' is variously defined as an unawareness of, indifference toward, or disbelief in any set of moral standards or principles.<ref>
+
'''Morality''' (from the [[Latin]] ''{{Lang|la|moralitas}}'' "manner, character, proper behavior") is a [[understanding|sense]] of [[behavior]]al conduct that differentiates intentions, decisions, and [[Social actions|actions]] between those that are good (or right) and bad (or wrong). A ''moral code'' is a system of morality (for example, according to a particular [[philosophy]], [[religion]], [[culture]], etc.) and a ''moral'' is any one practice or teaching within a moral code. ''Immorality'' is the active opposition to morality, while ''amorality'' is variously defined as an unawareness of, indifference toward, or disbelief in any set of moral standards or principles.<ref>
